snippet: Twitter said it would no longer license its stream of half a billion daily tweets to resellers, a sign that it wants to play a bigger role in how companies use it to glean insights about their customers.
abstract: Twitter said it would no longer license its stream of half a billion daily tweets to resellers, a sign that it wants to play a bigger role in how companies use it to glean insights about their customers.

headline.main: Twitter’s Evolving Plans to Make Money From Its Data Stream
headline.print_headline: Twitter Sees New Value In Its ‘Fire Hose’ of Data
